If you think you may have been banned erroneously, send a Support Ticket in. Player Support will be able to look up your account, check out any games that may not have made it onto your reform card (you do not necessarily get every reported chat sent to you), and find out if there has been any error on their end. It's possible you received a glitched reform card that didn't contain all the chat logs it should have, it's possible (but unlikely) there was an error on Riot's end, and it's possible that you simply had a large number of games with minor toxicity immediately after coming off a 14-day ban, which would be sufficient to get you banned permanently. They'll be able to help you figure out which it is, although if you want to get results I'd recommend being a little more polite to the support specialist than you were in, say, the opening post of this thread.

Riot does not restrict players to bot matches until they grasp the concept because they do not have a problem with players having bad matches.  They do however have a problem with extreme amounts of toxicity.  And just reading through this post: 

>....because the rest of your team are literal chimps?.... with his inbred ass....Next time my handicapped friend!...suck on my big fat cockasaurus rex ass dick! 

If you were given an immediate 14 day suspension for toxicity, something fairly bad was said in them, and they sent you logs of what not to say in your Reform Card.  Even if your team actually was made up of handicapped inbred chimpanzees, it doesn't give you the right to violate the Terms of Use and flame them.  You knew what not to do, you had only been off the temporary suspension for one game, and you chose to flame again.  You have nobody else to blame but yourself.  And while you are free to make another account, and to play on it, if you continue to act in this manner, you will probably get it banned as well.

This part is both sarcastic, which doesn't violate the ToS, and insulting, which does.  Calling someone outright bad for no other reason than to insult them is flaming and is against the rules.  It's also just plain bad sportsmanship.  No one wants to have to deal with someone who acts like that in a match.  If Janna starts trashtalking you, mute her, report her, and move on.  There's no reason to lower yourself to her level, especially when you are the one who was in danger of losing your account. 

> OGODTheAftermath: all that shit talking janna
> OGODTheAftermath: feels bad man

And this is not flaming, but it's bad form to taunt someone for losing, no matter what they said.

As to why do they allow cross team chat during a match?  Not all players use it to taunt or flame the other team.  Quite a few players use it to talk to friends they have on the other side, or to compliment plays made by the enemy.  It's used much more often for positive chat than it is for negative.  Individual players have the option to disable all chat if they are worried about responding to taunts.
